sentences.english: My good friend, Dr. Henry Kissinger, wrote a wonderful foreword, which adds luster to the book.
sentences.chinese: 我的好朋友辛格博士寫了精彩的序言，爲這本書增色。

sentences.english: This stamp has added to the album.
sentences.chinese: 這張郵票給郵冊增色不少。

sentences.english: Many great people will be gracing the opening night of the play.
sentences.chinese: 許多重要人物的光臨將爲此劇的首演增色不少。

sentences.english: Partner them with a viticella clematis for late-summer colour.
sentences.chinese: 配上蔓生鐵線蓮可以給末夏增色。

sentences.english: Men have many options for making short hairstyles work well for them.
sentences.chinese: 男人們有很多讓人增色的短髮樣式可供選擇。

sentences.english: Coconuts and powder-like sand help too.
sentences.chinese: 椰林和滑石粉般細膩的沙子也會爲沙灘增色不少。

sentences.english: He hashed a phrase in order to colour the sentence.
sentences.chinese: 他反覆推敲一個習語以使該句增色。

sentences.english: A little sugar will add to the taste of the fish.
sentences.chinese: 只需少許糖就會使這魚的味道增色不少。

sentences.english: His remarks haloed the party greatly.
sentences.chinese: 他的講話爲晚會增色不少。

sentences.english: You should also understand how to use music to your advantage.
sentences.chinese: 你也應該知道如何利用音樂爲自己增色。

sentences.english: The food stuff really zips up the salad dressing.
sentences.chinese: 這食材真是爲沙拉醬增色不少。

sentences.english: Using appropriate quotations from classics will add lustre to your essay.
sentences.chinese: 恰當地稱引名篇會使你的文章增色不少。

definition: the brush stroke that dots in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
to paint a dragon and dot in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
to add the finishing touch (abbr. for 畫龍點睛|画龙点睛[hua4 long2 dian3 jing1])
having a unique or distinctive style
background (of a painting)/backdrop/a foil (to set off something to advantage)/to offset (something to advantage)
lit. on brocade, add flowers (idiom); to decorate sth already perfect/gilding the lily
a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
to bring out the best in each other (idiom)/to complement one another well
